body:
Building hdf5 ~fortran with a compilers.yaml compiler where "f77: null" and "fc: null" were set in the yaml produces a KeyError: 'F77'. Must I specify a fortran compiler even if I don't want to build any fortran?

### Expected Result

Successful hdf5 installation:

```console
$ ./bin/spack install hdf5@1.8.12%gcc@4.9.3 cppflags="-fPIC -g" ~cxx~debug~fortran~hl~mpi+pic~shared~szip~threadsafe arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ cat compilers.yaml
compilers:
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: rhel7
    paths:
      cc: /usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-4.9.3/bin/gcc
      cxx: /usr/tce/packages/gcc/gcc-4.9.3/bin/g++
      f77: null
      fc: null
    spec: gcc@4.9.3
    target: x86_64
$ mkdir -p ~/.spack/linux/ && cp compilers.yaml ~/.spack/linux
$ git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
$ ./spack/bin/spack install hdf5@1.8.12%gcc@4.9.3 cppflags="-fPIC -g"
```

### Information on your system
LLNL toss3 system **rzgenie** using the following ~/.spack/linux/compilers.yaml

```console
$ cat ~/.spack/linux/compilers.yaml
compilers:
- compiler:
    environment: {}

    spec: gcc@4.9.3
    target: x86_64
```
